label: 班田
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A system whereby the government allotted sustenance rice fields (kubunden) and other kinds of land to the people in fixed amounts. Reallotments of sustenance rice fields took place every sixth year. The system soon proved impracticable and was finally abolished. [口分田]
